message: Best wishes to everyone in #MI11 for a happy, healthy, and successful New Year!

Ford’s $700 million investment in the Flat Rock manufacturing plant underscores the continued resurgence of our domestic manufacturing industry. It symbolizes a shift in our nation’s economic tide, one that can be attributed to the business-friendly policies expected from the President-elect and the new Congress. After 8 years of burdensome economic policy, this shift in fiscal policy will lay an economic landscape conducive to the growth and success of businesses of all sizes and our nation’s continued economic prosperity.
I want to hear from you! As we kick off the 115th Congress, take a moment to let me know what issues are most important to you.

Honored my colleagues have chosen me to serve on the House Committee on Financial Services. Let's get to work: 1) creating jobs and economic growth  2) simplifying our nation's convoluted tax code  3) increasing access to financial resources

I heard you! Earlier this week, I asked you what issues were most important to you, and many of the hundreds of responses focused on government accountability and transparency. That's why, at the end of the week, I introduced 2 bills that would restore transparency and accountability to Washington by tightening the lobbying restrictions placed on former Members of Congress. Our democracy is rooted in a government for the people by the people, and it's Congress' duty to focus on the interests of their constituents, not which corporation or foreign government will give them the fattest paycheck.
I am wishing a Merry Christmas and Happy Feast of the Nativity to Southeast Michigan's Orthodox Christian families today! #MI11
As we wrap up the first week of the 115th Congress, I want to know what issues are most affecting you and your family. Send me an email at https://trott.house.gov/contact/email
Thank you to Southeast Michigan's law enforcement officers and their families. Each and every day these officers put their lives on the line to protect ours.

Less than a week after Ford announced its $700 million investment in Flat Rock, there is more encouraging news from our domestic auto industry – another $1 billion. Fiat Chrysler Automobiles: Corporate's investment in the retooling and modernizing of manufacturing facilities in Warren and Toledo is an investment in the future of the U.S.  manufacturing industry, a commitment the resilient men and women who work the lines, and a recognition of their unparalleled American ingenuity.

I introduced legislation that would tighten lobbying restrictions on former Members of Congress, helping ensure that, during their time in Congress, their work is dedicated to the interests of the American people, not which foreign government will give them the fattest paycheck.

What do iconic companies Google, Facebook, and Amazon have in common?  They were all initially funded by "angel investors", investors who invest capital in the early stages of startups. Today, I supported legislation that would provide all small startups with greater access to these investors allowing them to grow their business and drive our economy.
More great news, more jobs for Michigan's 11th! This time it's Uber opening an autonomous integration center in Wixom, Michigan.

A rupture of Enbridge Line 5 under the Straits of Mackinac poses a serious risk to our Great Lakes, threatening 700 miles of shoreline and 17,000 square miles of open water. Today, Rep. Debbie Dingell and I introduced legislation that demands a comprehensive study of this environmental and economic risk, and should this study find that Line 5 poses too high a risk, requires the Department of Transportation shut it down.
Did you hear Rep. Debbie Dingell and I on WJR Radio's The Frank Beckmann Show this morning? Our demand for a comprehensive study of Enbridge's Line 5 is something you're not going to want to miss.
Cut through the rhetoric and get the facts on today's Affordable Care Act vote.

Today, all Americans reflect on the selflessness and sacrifice of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. He spent his life working to ensure our nation renewed its founding principles of liberty and justice for everyone. Dr. King's legacy continues today, and his memory will never be forgotten.
Get ready for the 58th Presidential Inauguration with these fun facts from inaugurations past.

The world's largest automotive interiors suppliers' move to Novi underscores the continued resurgence of our domestic automotive industry and is a testament to the city's future as a business and innovation hub in SE Michigan.
Happy birthday to the beautiful Great Lakes State. You look pretty good for 180!

How do you get your art displayed in the U.S. Capitol building? Every year, I sponsor a district-wide Congressional high school art competition to recognize the artistic talent of so many young people all across SE Michigan. If you, or a high school student you know, are an aspiring artist, I encourage you to enter by visiting trott.house.gov/artcompetition
I want your take.
Join me on February 7th at 5PM for my tele-town hall. Sign up below!
Detroit's going to #SuperBowl LI!  Well, its Blackhawks are.

Michigan manufacturers don't need special treatment. The unparelleled product of the hardworking men and women of Michigan speaks for itself. But, I think we can all agree they deserve a level playing field.

Ontario Power Generation has proposed a plan to bury nuclear waste within a mile of Lake Huron. Representing one-fifth of the world’s fresh surface water, the Great Lakes are one of the most critical and sensitive ecosystems in the world. Today, I echoed the concerns of Oakland County and over 23 million people and once again voiced my opposition to this dangerous proposal. Ontario Power Generation needs to select a location outside the Great Lakes Basin.
Great conversation today in Clawson with members of the Macedonian community – it was great to hear their thoughts and feedback. #MI11
Don't forget! Today is the last day to sign up for my tele-town hall tomorrow at 5PM. Look forwarding to hearing from you!

TELE-TOWN HALL UPDATE: Due to the timing of votes on the House Floor this evening, my live tele-town hall will be moved to around 6:00PM. If you signed up for my live tele-town hall, please expect my call around 6:00PM. I look forward to speaking with you!
Allow me to pass along your regards to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi by sharing a short message with him below. There are also message binders located at local temples throughout #MI11!

Michigan mourns the loss of one of the greatest Detroiters of our time, a true icon, Mike Illitch. As someone who believed in the Comeback City when so few others did, he never lost faith in the resilience and resurgence of the city and people that made him. Having poured his heart and passion into the rebuilding of the city he loved so much, Mike Illitch is someone who brought immense pride to the great city of Detroit.

Honored to be 1 of only 14 Members of Congress and the only Michigan Member to receive an A+ score from the 21st Century Wilberforce Initiative for protecting and advancing international religious freedom.

Today marks the birthday of the father of our nation, President George Washington - a man who won a war for liberty, led our nation during its first days, and then changed the world by having the humility to step aside and let the people - not monarchs - choose the future.

I sent a letter to the Secretary of Homeland Security, U.S. Attorney General, and Director of the FBI urging them to take swift action to address the significant number of bomb threats that have been received by Jewish Community Centers, including the JCC in West Bloomfield. We need to deter such threats from being made, identify and prosecute the perpetrators for violations of federal criminal laws, and enable JCCs to enhance security measures, such as physical barriers and guards, in the event that an individual seeks to act upon these threats.

We need to work together to achieve reforms that actually lower health care costs, provide greater access to quality care, and protect patients with pre-existing conditions' access to the health care they need.

An estimated 7,000 rare diseases affect nearly 30 million Americans, over half of which are children, and their families every single day. A lack of research, ineffective treatments, and a lack of public awareness often make coping with these rare diseases more difficult and frustrating. Today, Rare Disease Day, raises public awareness, helping encourage improved treatments and greater support for patients and their families.
RIGHT NOW: POTUS addresses a #JointSession of Congress. Watch LIVE: www.houselive.gov
This afternoon, I met with Steve from Novi to hear about his experience living with a rare disease and how we can protect patients with rare diseases' access to the health care they need.
I valued hearing from the President about his vision for our country and his ideas on the future of our nation. Here's my take:
Don't miss my op-ed in today's Detroit News.

The Great Lakes Restoration Initiative has made great strides in protecting and preserving our magnificent Great Lakes. I have, and will continue to, advocate for this vital program, which is why I sent a letter to the President urging for full funding of this important program --> https://trott.house.gov/sites/trott.house.gov/files/GLRI%20Budget%20Request%20Final%20Letter%2002.13.17.pdf

Asian carp have swiftly made their way up the Mississippi River, destroying nearly every ecosystem in their path. Recently identified just south of the Brandon Road Lock and Dam, I urge the President to take a closer look at what's at stake.   Our magnificent Great Lakes are not only one of our country's most prized natural wonders, they also provide 95% of the U.S.' fresh drinking water, and support over $20 billion in recreational and commercial industries a year.
Great to stop by the Dublin Senior Center in White Lake and Cantoro Italian Market & Trattoria to talk small business with owners Michael and John.

At a time when anti-Semitism is dangerously on the rise, our nation must take a strong stand to protect the ideals of religious freedom and liberty at home and abroad. Proud to join my colleagues Rep. Brenda Lawrence & Rep Sandy Levin in urging the appointment of a special envoy.

This Saturday, March 18th, I invite you to join me for a public town hall meeting at 8:30am at Suburban Collection Showplace in Novi. The doors open at 8:00am.  I look forward to seeing you there! For more information, please click the link below.

I valued hearing from President Donald J. Trump and the leaders of the world’s automotive industry at Willow Run today. We need to advance policies that encourage American companies to stay on this side of the border, crack down on currency manipulators, and eliminate regulatory burdens on American businesses so we can encourage economic growth while protecting our environment.

Yesterday, I joined General Motors CEO Mary Barra, Ford Motor Company CEO Mark Fields, Fiat Chrysler Automobiles CEO Sergio Marchionne, and President Donald J. Trump at Willow Run to discuss the future of the auto industry and how we can better encourage economic growth and foster innovation.
Thank you to everyone who came out today in Novi!
TUNE IN LIVE this morning from 9:00AM-12:00PM on WJR Radio as I guest host for Frank Beckmann! We'll be talking to everyone from Governor Rick Snyder to an asteroid hunter. Don't miss it on 760 AM.
Great to meet with Michiganders including Amy from Trinity Health in Livonia to talk about supporting our seniors with affordable senior housing options.

The world has not forgotten the heartbreaking deaths that occurred in 1915, when Ottoman authorities initiated a concerted offensive, specifically targeting Armenians in an attempt to exterminate their race. However, for far too long many have refused to recognize the genocide waged against the Armenian people. As someone who is honored to be able to represent such a vibrant Armenian population in Southeast Michigan, I was proud to introduce a bipartisan House resolution that stands in solidarity with the Armenian people and officially recognizes the horrific events that transpired over a hundred years ago.

Congratulations to special education teacher Jodie Sikaitis who was named Novi's Teacher of the Year! Her uplifting story is reflective of the passion and commitment #MI11 teachers have for their students.

Just a few months after announcing a $700 million investment, Ford Motor Company doubles down to invest a total of $1.2 billion in SE Michigan! Their continued investment underscores the ongoing resurgence of our domestic auto industry. #ComebackState
Today, I sat down with leaders of Southeast Michigan's Jewish-American community to discuss how we can combat the nation-wide rise of anti-semitism.

Every 66 seconds someone in the United States develops Alzheimer's Disease. In fact, it's the 6th leading cause of death in the nation. Today, I met with Laura from Novi to discuss how we can lead the fight against Alzheimer's, encouraging medical research and innovation and ensuring those with Alzheimer's and their families have access to the resources they need.
Shout out to the students of Emerson Middle School in Livonia. With them leading the way the future of our country looks bright! #LeaderInMySelfie

Great joining the JCRC / AJC: A Partnership for Community Relations and Jewish Advocacy for their Congressional Round Table in Bloomfield Hills to discuss the prevailing issues facing the SE MI Jewish community.
Speaking with the Oakland County Association of Township Supervisors, today, about everything happening in Washington and how it affects our communities. #MI11

#MI11 is the most ethnically diverse congressional district in Michigan, and such an important part of our district is the vibrant Armenian-American community. It was great to sit down with some of our Armenian-American neighbors to discuss my work in Congress on behalf of their community and our entire district.
Southeast Michigan is lucky to have such cultural diversity including our vibrant Indian-American community. It was great to hear from some of our Indian-American neighbors.

Already this year, North Korea has launched missiles that landed just 200 miles off the coast of Japan, and, now, they're closer than ever to developing intercontinental capabilities. The U.S. must stand strong with its allies against these overt acts of aggression, and, yesterday, I joined my House colleagues in doubling down against them.

Every day hardworking Michiganders pour their hearts and souls into a company so they can continue to provide for their families. And many companies recognize the commitment of their employees and want to be able to reward their dedication with a stake in the business they have helped build, a piece of the action - a shot at the American dream. This is why I supported legislation that would encourage and allow more companies to offer their employees a stake in the company. This is a win-win-win - providing more benefits for employees, allowing companies to reward and retain hardworking Michiganders, and encouraging continued economic growth. Learn more --> https://goo.gl/2U25E9
STEM education is critical to ensuring the next generation is equipped for a 21st century economy and the Northville High School Robostangs 548 are a great example. Good luck this weekend!
We need to protect + strengthen Medicare and Medicare Advantage for the almost 18 million seniors and individuals with disabilities who rely on them.

Michigan small businesses are the engines of job creation. In fact, small businesses create 7 of every 10 new jobs and employ over half of the nation's private sector workforce. Today, I supported overwhelmingly bipartisan legislation that ensures innovators and start-ups in SE Michigan have access to the capital they need to grow, create jobs, and drive our economy.

Last night, President Trump took precise, targeted action against Syria’s dictatorial regime, which waged a chemical attack against innocent men, women, and children – its own people. Decisive leadership on the world stage is what the United States needs as we stand strong in the face of terrorism. As a member of Congress, I look forward to working with President Trump and his Administration as they begin to lay out clear, strategic policy goals for the region.

I applaud my colleagues in the Senate’s confirmation of Judge Neil Gorsuch. He has some big shoes to fill, but as an experienced legal mind and staunch protector of the Constitution he is more than worthy of this prestigious seat on the Supreme Court.

My thoughts and prayers are with the Coptic Community at St. Mark Coptic Orthodox Church in Troy whose families in Egypt faced yet another series of targeted attacks as they begin the Holy Week. The two attacks this morning are part of a disturbing trend specifically targeting Coptic Christians in Egypt that has included attacks on houses of worship, religious cleansing in the Sinai, and now an unsuccessful attempt to murder the Coptic Pope. We need to work together to root out terrorism and identify the underlying causes of this deeply rooted sectarianism.
Wishing a Happy #Passover to all of our Jewish-American neighbors in Southeast Michigan!

It was an honor to join Harold Ortwine of Novi to finally present him with the medals he rightfully earned, a long overdue recognition of the bravery and heroism he embodied in defense of the traditions built by the Americans before him and the promise of every generation to come. It is thanks to the service of America's greatest generation that we have the privilege to enjoy the freedoms and liberties that make this country the greatest in the world!
Harold Ortwine from Novi's story is that of so many of those who represent America's Greatest Generation. Learn more about his unbelievable service defending our nation around the world.

It's National Library Week - a celebration of the vast intellectual and creative contributions of our communities' libraries and all those who serve there. I can think of no better place to celebrate this week than at one of the educational epicenters of our community - the Troy Public Library.
From my family to yours...We wish you a very happy and blessed #Easter!

National Park Week is here! #FindYourPark right here in our beautiful state: https://www.nps.gov/state/mi/index.htm Michigan is home to some of our nation's greatest natural wonders, including our magnificent Great Lakes. I will continue to fight to protect and preserve our Lakes by being an advocate for programs that restore and revitalize them, such as the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative, and combat the grave threat posed by Asian Carp.

Michigan welcomes over a hundred million international and domestic visitors each year, and it’s not hard to see why. Our beautiful state is home to some of the world’s greatest natural wonders, including our magnificent Great Lakes. In fact, visitors spend over $20 billion on lodging, food, and recreation, supporting more than 200,000 Michigan jobs. I sat down with the U.S. Travel Association in Michigan to discuss how we can encourage the continued growth of our state’s tourism industries and create more good paying jobs for hardworking Michigan families.

For the last 100 years, the Michigan State Police have selflessly put their lives on the line to protect ours. Today, and everyday, we thank them for their brave service and remember the heroes who have fallen in the line of duty. #MSP100

Chartered in 1959, members of the Novi Rotary Club have donated their time and resources, helping those in need right here in #MI11 for over 50 years. Great to stop by to thank our local Rotarians for all of the important work they do in our community and around the world.

Thanks to the bright students at Roosevelt Elementary in Livonia for welcoming me into their classroom as a guest reader! My favorite question of the afternoon was from an aspiring young foodie who asked "are there tacos in the Constitution?" The answer: Unfortunately, no.

Our Vietnam veterans served our nation with selflessness and bravery, and they deserve the appreciation of a very grateful nation. Over 50 years later, it is especially important that our veterans and their families are recognized for the extraordinary sacrifices they made. I was honored to present a pin commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Vietnam War to Kenneth Baetz of Bloomfield Hills in continued recognition of his exemplary service.

The unimaginable horror represented by the systematic murder of 11 million people, including 6 million of our Jewish brothers and sisters, makes it instinctive to suppress the terror waged during one of humanity’s darkest hours. However, #HolocaustRemembranceDay is a reminder that today, and every day, we must never forget the unthinkable acts carried out by the worst of humanity so we can ensure it never happens again.

#ArmenianGenocideRemembranceDay is a solemn reminder of the 1.5 million Armenians murdered by the Ottoman Turks in the early 1900s - a genocide that many still deny. It is time for us to stand with the over 17,000 Armenian-Americans in Michigan and the Armenian people around the world in recognizing this dark period of history. The world has not and will not forget.

Small businesses are the engines of job creation, creating 7 of every 10 new jobs nationwide. We need to continue to support our communities' small businesses by continuing to pass legislation like the Supporting America's Innovators Act, which gives them access to the resources they need to grow their business, create jobs, and continue to drive our economy. I joined some of Novi's small business leaders to discuss how we can continue to create more jobs for hardworking Michigan families.

These revelations show what we’ve known from the beginning: President Obama was willing to break his back and go to any length for Iran in order to cement his legacy.    This latest report only solidifies former Obama administration officials' claims that they created an “echo chamber” to sell this horrible deal to the American people. After 8 years of disastrous foreign policy, we need foreign policy that puts Americans' safety and priority first, not a foreign policy chapter in a memoir.

Today, the House Committee on Financial Services will hold a hearing on the #FinancialCHOICE Act which:  ✔ Ends too-big-to-fail  ✔ Ends bank bailouts & holds Wall Street accountable for its own risks  ✔ Grows financial opportunities for hardworking Michigan families
NA

Update from today's hearing:  Did you know the big banks on Wall Street actually OPPOSE the #CHOICEact? Perhaps it's because the #CHOICEact imposes the toughest penalties in history for financial fraud, self-dealing, and deception to protect consumers and strengthen markets.

RIGHT NOW: I'm headed from my office to the United States Capitol to receive a briefing from U.S. Secretary of State Tillerson, U.S. Secretary of Defense Mattis, and the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs on the threat posed by the rogue nation of North Korea. Already this year, we've witnessed multiple overt acts of North Korean aggression. We need to ensure the safety of Americans here and around the world.

Where are the best high schools in Michigan? 4 of the top 15 are right here in #MI11! Congratulations to the bright students at Walled Lake Northern High School, Novi High School, Troy High School (Michigan), and Athens High School and the dedicated teachers and educators who serve there.

Just stepped out of a meeting with Michigan healthcare professionals, including Tim Paige an ophthalmologist from Birmingham, to discuss improving our nation's healthcare system and the lives of hardworking Michigan families.

The federal government spent approximately $187 million in taxpayer funds to bail out Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. The kicker - these two entities were not subject to the Freedom of Information Act, which allows American citizens to request access to records and information. Considering the exorbitant amount of taxpayer money pumped into them, this week I voted for legislation that would apply the Freedom of Information Act to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, finally shedding light on these entities for hardworking Michigan taxpayers.

Congratulations to the clearly talented Maximillian, an 11th grader from Bloomfield Hills, who's a finalist in Emagine Theatres' Hush Reel Video Contest! Check out the other finalists from Oakland County here --> http://www.theoaklandpress.com/general-news/20170427/oakland-macomb-students-finalists-in-emagine-short-film-contest

Steven from Livonia more than earned the honor of Eagle Scout. He has made Troop 1241 and our entire community so proud! When Steven joined cub scouts back in 2010 his father was so sure he'd become an eagle scout he bought a minted silver coin that he kept hidden until this very special moment when he gifted it to Steven 7 years later. Congratulations to Steven and his proud family!

What an honor to join the Chaldean community of Southeast Michigan at its Annual Chaldean American Chamber of Commerce Awards Ceremony! As doctors, government leaders, and small business owners, Chaldean-Americans are such a vibrant part of our community. In fact, Chaldean-Americans contribute over $11 billion a year to Michigan's economy. It was an honor to join them to celebrate their community and culture and underscore the important role they play in the success of our great state.

During #SmallBusinessWeek we celebrate the millions of small businesses throughout the country and Michigan that fuel our nation's economic growth. In fact, small businesses create 7 of every 10 new jobs nationwide. We need to support our communities' entrepreneurs and innovators by ensuring they have access to the resources they need to grow their business, create jobs, and continue to drive our economy
In our nation's enviable democracy, no one is above the law. Members of Congress must abide by the laws they create.

While the health care legislation voted on today is not perfect, I believe, it is a better approach than was taken by the Affordable Care Act. The bill instills patient-centered reforms that will reduce costs and includes important safeguards for patients. Since day one, I have continued to underscore my belief that health care reform include protections for those with pre-existing conditions. Make no mistake, the American Health Care Act earned my support by doing just that.
Yesterday, the House also passed H.R. 2192, which requires Members of Congress to live under the American Health Care Act, ensuring there are no exemptions for Members or their staff.

Regrettably, there has been a lot of misinformation spread about the American Health Care Act, especially regarding how the bill protects people with pre-existing conditions. Here is the truth: Under no circumstance can people be denied coverage because of a pre-existing condition. Current law prohibiting pricing customers based on health status remains in place and can only be waived by a state if that state has chosen to take care of the people through other risk-sharing or reinsurance mechanisms. Even if a state asks for and is granted a waiver, no person may be priced based on health status if they have maintained continuous coverage.

Since coming to Congress, I have been committed to replacing the Affordable Care Act with common-sense solutions that give every Michigan family access to affordable, high-quality care.  I believe the verdict on the Affordable Care Act was rendered last November, and Michigan voters made it clear they want to see a new direction for our nation's health care system.
My office is accepting nominations to the U.S. Service Academies! If you or any young person in your life is interested in a nomination, please check out our website to learn more and apply.

Thank you to the Milford Senior Center knitting group for sharing their talent, providing homemade quilts to children in area hospitals, hospice patients, and others in need. Their hard work helps brighten the days of so many one stitch at a time!

Today we honor the loving, hard-working, and dedicated mothers of Southeast Michigan. Pictured here is my mom--the strongest and most caring woman I've ever known. I hope you will join me in wishing every mom a wonderful and blessed #MothersDay

Without hesitation, law enforcements officials selflessly put their lives on the line each and every day. Today, on National Peace Officers Memorial Day, we thank them and their families for their immense sacrifice and honor those who gave their lives to protect ours.
Throughout National Police Week, I hope you join me in thanking the brave police officers of #MI11 who selflessly put their lives on the line every day to protect ours. #PoliceWeek2017

As we honor our brave law enforcement officials this week, during National Police Week, we are once again reminded of the heroic acts our police officers carry out each and every day. On the very first call of his career, Northville Township Police Officer Tyler Schmittou, without hesitation, leaped into action, saving the life of a 64-year-old in cardiac arrest. Officer Schmittou’s heroic act is a singular, yet powerful, testament of the selflessness embodied by all of Southeast Michigan’s first responders.

The brutal attack by Turkish President Erdogan’s henchmen on peaceful protestors outside of the Turkish Ambassador’s Residence in Washington, D.C. is unacceptable. While this incident is reflective of the Turkish government’s broad suppression of democracy, this is the United States and these overt acts of violence against those expressing their First Amendment right will not be tolerated.
My thoughts and prayers are with the family and friends of fellow Michigander Alyssa Elsman during this very difficult time.

BREAKING: Ford Motor Company to add jobs with new fuel-efficient transmission production, right here, at the Ford Livonia Automatic Transmission Plant. This investment is further testament to the unparalleled work product of the hardworking men and women of #MI11.

During National Police Week, in honoring our local law enforcement officials, I supported legislation which: ✔ Allows states to honor local fallen officers by lowering their flags to half-staff as a reminder of their great sacrifice ✔ Provides local and state units with the resources they need to combat 21st century threats ✔ Ensures our local police officers have the resources they need to safely and effectively do their jobs

FBI Agent Bryan Drake of South Lyon was honored in D.C. for his instrumental role in the take-down of Dr. Farid Fata. His tireless work ensured Dr. Fata, a criminal who exploited the trust of the sacred doctor-patient relationship, was brought to justice.

In 1949, President Harry S. Truman led the effort to establish a single holiday for Americans to come together and thank our nation's troops for their service in defense of our country. At the time, there were actually separate Army, Navy, Marine Corps, and Air Force Days. Today, as we celebrate the, now, established and singular Armed Forces Day, I hope you will join me in thanking our military members for their unwavering patriotic duty to our nation.

Excited to announce this year's Congressional High School Art Competition winner is Walled Lake Central High School student Nathan Adkins. A testament to the immense talent of Southeast Michigan's many young artists, Nathan's artwork will be displayed in the U.S. Capitol building in Washington, D.C. Congratulations, Nathan!
My thoughts and prayers are with the victims, their families, and the city of #Manchester. We stand strong with our unwaveringly ally, the United Kingdom, in the face of terror.

Every year, I sponsor a district-wide HS art competition to recognize the immense talent of so many young people across Southeast Michigan. This year's winners represent just a few of the many young artists in #MI11. Their creativity and eye for art brings such tremendous pride to our entire community.

Time and time again, one of the biggest concerns I hear from my constituents is the federal government’s willingness to put itself above the law – a feeling that has greatly contributed to the lack of trust many Americans have in Congress. That's why I, and my Democratic colleague Congressman David Cicilline, introduced the ETHICS Act, requiring ethics training for all Members of the House of Representatives.

In April of 1970, while others were awaiting their draft notices, 20-year-old Petty Officer Crutchfield took it upon himself to enlist and serve his country. Almost 50 years later, just a few days before Memorial Day, Officer Crutchfield of Livonia joins his nephew, also a veteran, in solemnly folding a flag that was flown over the U.S. Capitol.

The Coptic community in Egypt has been targeted yet again as a part of a disturbing trend that has included attacks on houses of worship, religious cleansing in the Sinai, and an attempted murder of the Coptic Pope. We need to work together to root out terrorism and identify the underlying causes of this deeply rooted sectarianism.

This weekend, we solemnly remembered the brave servicemen and women who made the ultimate sacrifice protecting our freedoms and liberties in the line of duty. It was an especially somber moment in Wixom as Marine Lance Cpl. Justin Ellsworth was recognized in his hometown for his unwavering commitment to his country.

As a father, it is hard to imagine more disturbing crimes than those committed against our children. The most innocent and precious members of our society, they are our nation’s future, and I supported initiatives that will strengthen and protect their safety.

180,000 Michiganders are living with Alzheimer's Disease. In fact, it's the 6th leading cause of death in the nation. Throughout June, Alzheimer's Awareness Month, we must continue the conversation, raising awareness for and encouraging medical research and innovation to combat this debilitating and devastating disease. #ENDALZ
BREAKING: Legislation I introduced to assist Habitat for Humanity in their important work will come to the House Floor for a vote this week!

Great to sit down with Ken Harris, President and CEO of the Michigan Black Chamber of Commerce, Inc., at Kerby's Koney Island this afternoon to discuss how we can continue to encourage entrepreneurship and promote business growth right here in SE Michigan. The unparalleled diversity of our community is a critical component of its remarkable success!

Today, we recognize the 73rd anniversary of D-Day, a singular event that marked the turning point of World War II. An Allied victory would not have been possible without the 160,000 brave soldiers who stormed the beaches of Normandy that day.

We witnessed the brutal attack carried out by the Turkish President's henchmen on peaceful protestors, right here, in the U.S. This incident is reflective of the Turkish government’s broad suppression of democracy, but this is America, and these overt acts of violence against those expressing their First Amendment right will not be tolerated. I supported a resolution not only condemning this attack, but demanding the perpetrators be brought to justice.
Combating Canada's foolhardy and dangerous nuclear waste plan is critical to protecting our Great Lakes. Inaction is too high a price to pay.
If you need help with anything from federal agencies to requesting tours, I'm always here to help: https://trott.house.gov/services

Habitat for Humanity of Michigan supports over 80 affiliates statewide whose over 200,000 dedicated volunteers come together to help Michigan families in need. Today, the House passed the HOME Act, my legislation to ensure Habitat can receive the donated resources it needs to continue helping families in Michigan and nationwide.

Canada proposed storing nuclear waste ONE mile from the Great Lakes?! Rep. Debbie Dingell & I demand Secretary Tillerson and the U.S. Department of State do everything they can - diplomatic and legal - to stop this dangerous plan and protect our Great Lakes.
Get out there and don't miss Free Fishing Weekend today and tomorrow!

In 2014, Americans learned of the horrific treatment so many of our nation's brave servicemen and women received at the Phoenix VA Hospital. Today, in my commitment to our nation's veterans, I will continue my efforts to ensure they receive the quality care they have earned as the House votes on the VA Accountability and Whistleblower Protection Act --> https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/senate-bill/1094

As someone who never hesitated to put his life on the line to protect his fellow soldiers and our nation, we will never be able to sufficiently thank Mr. McCloughan for his service. The highest military honor is more than well-deserved!

Our nation's veterans have earned nothing less than the highest quality care. In my continued commitment to our country's heroes, I supported the largest VA reform legislation in years, restoring accountability to the VA by finally holding bad employees accountable.
Praying for my colleagues, their staff, the U.S. Capitol Police, and all those affected this morning in Alexandria.

Congratulations to Detroit Catholic Central High School's Quiz Bowl Team for winning 1st place at Partnership for Academic Competition Excellence's National Scholastic Championship. They are some of our community's and country's best and brightest!

On my way to votes, yesterday, I walked by Nathan Adkins artwork "Split", which won 1st place in this year's #MI11 Congressional Art Competition and was just hung in the United States Capitol for everyone to admire. Excited for Nathan to come view his magnificent piece!

In line with my continued calls, the perpetrators of this horrific attack on peaceful protestors are being brought to justice. This incident is reflective of the Turkish government’s broad suppression of democracy, but this is America, and these overt acts of violence against those expressing their First Amendment right will not be tolerated.

Over the last 2 weeks, I have been in contact with leaders of the Chaldean community and the Department of Homeland Security as we continue to gather all relevant information. I believe it’s critical the government takes a measured approach to this very sensitive situation, while strongly upholding the laws of our country. This correspondence, sent last week, is one of the many avenues I have pursued as this situation continues to develop.

From combating currency manipulation to protecting our Great Lakes, I've been proud to work with my colleague Rep. Debbie Dingell on important issues that affect every day Michiganders. Before we are Republicans and Democrats we are, first and foremost, Americans.
My office is accepting nominations to the U.S. Service Academies! If you or any young person in your life is interested in a nomination, please check out my website to learn more and apply.

Yesterday, terror struck, right here, at home. The swift actions of Lt. Jeff Neville and our state's law enforcement officials protected the lives of so many innocent civilians. I will continue to closely monitor this developing situation so we can thwart future attacks against our communities.

I was honored to present Emily Prokop of Birmingham with The Congressional Award Gold Medal. Her over 400 hours of community service, have more than earned her this award, which is the highest honor Congress can bestow upon a youth civilian!

Having put their lives on the line to protect our nation, today, we kept our promise to our veterans in ensuring these heroes receive the care they need. After years of work in Congress, the President signed into law the largest VA reform legislation in years, a law that holds bad actors accountable and protects the whistleblowers that expose them.

A live Asian carp was caught just 9 miles from Lake Michigan. Destroying nearly every ecosystem in their path we cannot afford to wait as they swim full-bore towards our Great Lakes. I joined in introducing legislation that would require the administration release the study they delayed, which provides critical information in determining how we can stop this invasive species from decimating our lakes.
Is one of the 5 service academies right for you? Find out: https://trott.house.gov/militaryacademynominations
What an honor to recognize some of SE Michigan's most dedicated community servants at the Lakes Area Chamber of Commerce. They are a critical part of what makes our community so vibrant.

Throughout their military service, veterans attain valuable professional skills, such as truck driving or welding. However, upon returning home they are often unable to transition these skills into civilian jobs. I introduced legislation that aids in this transition, ensuring they can utilize their skills to begin a successful career.

Veterans returning home wishing to continue their education are often times met with curriculum counselors who are unfamiliar with how to accurately transfer their experience in the military to college credits. I introduced legislation that would establish training for these counselors, helping returning service members receive the appropriate college credits, ensuring the maximum use of their GI bill benefits and the efficient use of taxpayer dollars.

Great to sit down with Michigan palliative care providers and advocates. I was proud to cosponsor H.R. 1676, legislation that would provide support for palliative care programs, which prevents and provides relief from pain for patients and their families.

In May, we witnessed Turkish bodyguards brutally attack peaceful protestors on U.S. soil. Now we're selling weapons to these same henchmen? I led a bipartisan coalition of 35 Members of Congress in standing up and saying absolutely not. This deal would be nothing less than an endorsement of these thugs.

What an honor to welcome Walled Lake HS student Nathan Adkins to the United States Capitol. As Best in Show in MI11's Congressional Art Competition his artwork is now displayed in the Capitol building. His impressive talent is reflective of the great promise of so many young artists in our community.

With a live Asian carp caught 9 miles from Lake Michigan, we cannot afford to stand idly by as this invasive species swims full bore towards the Great Lakes. We need all of the information regarding possible solutions - especially the critical information in this study - so we can effectively prevent Asian carp from decimating our lakes.

Wishing everyone in Southeast Michigan a wonderful and blessed Independence Day. I hope your 4th of July is filled with fireworks, fun, and good times with family and friends. Happy Birthday to the greatest country the world has ever known!

My office is looking for fall interns for our Troy, Michigan office. If you or anyone you know is interested in joining our team and being a part of a Congressional office, please call my office today. #MI11

Proud to nominate 12 bright students to West Point, Annapolis, and the Coast Guard academy. They are the best and brightest, and with them leading the way the future has never looked more promising. Congratulations!

What a pleasure to sit down with such bright young Michiganders visiting our nation's capital to experience our country's democracy first-hand. Their informed questions and passion for political engagement was so encouraging. I cannot wait to see what these students do next!

Michigan is the #2 state for human trafficking, an epidemic that decimates the most vulnerable among us - our children. That's why I supported 3 pieces of legislation critical to continuing to crackdown on this horrific illegal trade and implementing stronger detention systems for the perpetrators of these unconscionable crimes.  ✔ Frederick Douglass Trafficking Victims Prevention and Protection Act ✔ Enhancing Detection of Human Trafficking Act ✔ Empowering Law Enforcement to Fight Sex Trafficking Demand Act
We always knew it, but now it's official. Michigan's #1! That's right, Ohio.
Interested in joining these bright students? I'm accepting applications for next year --> trott.house.gov/militaryacademynominations

Great to sit down with Anya, a junior at Troy High School (Michigan), today, to discuss our nation's government and everything we can do to better our great State of Michigan. I cannot wait to see what she does next. Such an insightful young woman is sure to do great things.

It's unanimous! The House passed my bipartisan legislation, the SERVE Act, to aid returning veterans' transition back into the civilian workforce. This important legislation will have a real, on-the-ground impact for Michigan veterans and their families →  https://trott.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/unanimous-trott-s-veteran-jobs-legislation-passes-us-house

I've said it before, and I'll say it again: the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative is critical to protecting and preserving our magnificent Great Lakes. We've secured full funding for this year, and, this week, we got one step closer to securing it for next year. I have, and will continue to, fight for this critical program. The future of our lakes depends on it!

Turkish President Erdogan's bodyguards brutally attacked peaceful protestors, right here, on U.S. soil. The House unanimously passed my legislation to halt a proposed arms deal to these same henchmen - finally holding them accountable for who they really are - thugs.

Cyberspace is the 21st century battlefield, and among our most vulnerable targets is our nation's energy infrastructure. Earlier this month, it was reported that Russian hackers penetrated our nuclear power network. While our intelligence agencies work to identify the perpetrator, the House passed legislation that would help states combat these ever-evolving threats, inspiring new tools that will secure our electrical grid and energy infrastructure. Read the bill  → https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/3050

Drug overdoses are now the leading cause of injury-related death in Michigan. The opioid epidemic has affected those from every walk of life and, now, 87 pounds of heroin were found, right here, in Novi. I am encouraged to announce that the Centers for Disease Control has just increased funding for Michigan to strengthen its prevention efforts and combat the rise of this heartbreaking epidemic.

John McCain is a true American hero, and my prayers are with him and his loved ones during this difficult time. I have no doubt that he will confront this challenge with the same tenacity and perseverance we so admire him for.

These doctors, and all those who commit these horrendous crimes against innocent children, must be held accountable for their unconscionable actions. That's why I introduced legislation that would triple the current federal penalty, helping to eradicate this barbaric practice from our communities.

Our world has drastically changed since the Dept. of Homeland Security was formed in the wake of 9/11. That's why I voted for bipartisan legislation that ensures those who secure our airports, borders, and seaports have the resources they need to combat 21st century threats, while creating efficiencies that protect your tax dollars.
GREAT NEWS ➜ We're another step closer to ensuring we continue to protect and preserve our Great Lakes.
Having fought to defend our country on the front lines, our nation’s veterans are the real heroes, and I will never stop fighting for them in Congress. #AmericanHeroesWeek

My thoughts and prayers continue to be with Officer McClain and his family as he makes, what I hope will be, a very speedy recovery. I extend my most sincere condolences to the loved ones of Mr. Campbell, an innocent life lost in this horrible accident.

I'm cracking down on the tyrants who seek to annihilate our democracy and working hard to hold them accountable. That's why I just voted to impose punishing economic sanctions on Russia, Iran, and North Korea. Choking off their economic lifeline smothers their ability to undermine our national security.

During #SharkWeek read up on legislation I supported to prohibit the possession, purchase, or sale of shark fins in the U.S. We can no longer subject our finned friends to such a cruel practice. ➜ https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/1456

Asian carp aren't slowing down, and we can't afford to either. That's why, this evening, the House passed legislation that calls on the Army Corps of Engineers to release the Brandon Road Lock and Dam study, which contains information critical to learning how we can stop this invasive species.
BREAKING NEWS ➜ The Army Corps of Engineers has announced it will finally release this study, which is critical to stopping Asian carp from infiltrating our Great Lakes.

As someone who never hesitated to put his life on the line to protect his fellow soldiers and our nation, we will never be able to sufficiently thank Mr. McCloughan for his service. The highest military honor is more than well-deserved!
Sandra from Livonia sent me an email urging support for our nation's veterans. Here's what she had to say.

Russia, Iran, & North Korea - these are some of our world's most nefarious actors. I applaud President Trump's implementation of these new sanctions, which choke off their economic lifelines and their ability to undermine our national security.

Thank you to all of the bright high school students who came out this evening to learn more about our nation's service academies. If you or someone you know is interested in applying, learn more here: https://trott.house.gov/militaryacademynominations
Happy 227th Birthday to the U.S. Coast Guard and the brave Coast Guardsmen who protect our waterways and all those who traverse them.

Have you sent me an email? Check out this week's Constituent Inbox to see if yours was highlighted.  Remember, you can always email me here ➜ https://trott.house.gov/contact/email. I look forward to hearing from you!

From eBooks to social media and animation classes, the Auburn Hills Public Library is a library of the 21st century. It was a pleasure to join its dedicated staff and donate a variety of books from The Library of Congress to its already impressive collection.
Lisa from Northville asked about Russia. Here's the answer.

We need less divisiveness and more unity. It's so important that we come together in a bipartisan fashion to combat the opioid epidemic, to require ethics training for Members of Congress, to do what's best for our nation. Anthony from Wixom said it best. Don't miss what he had to say.
Kim from Troy asks about the grave threat that seeks to destroy a $20 billion industry.

EMERGENCY DECLARATION: The rise of the opioid epidemic has plagued our communities, robbing us of so many promising young people. Last year, I was instrumental in the passage of the Comprehensive Addiction and Recovery Act, and I have continued to work hard to ensure our communities have the tools they need to combat this crisis. However, it's clear we need more, and President Trump's declaration of this epidemic as a national emergency is another step in the right direction.
The violence we witnessed in Charlottesville by white supremacists, this weekend, is intolerable. There is no place for such hatred and bigotry in our country.

Since 1944, Michigan CAT has provided Michiganders with the tools they need to build our great state from the ground up. It was great to stop by their facility in Novi to learn more about how we can create an economic environment that allows Michigan owned and operated businesses to continue to invest, right here, in our communities.

Vern dedicated his life to the service of others. Known for his common-sense approach, he was a statesman, an intellectual, and a teacher respected by his colleagues on both sides of the aisle. Michigan and our entire nation has lost a great champion. My thoughts and prayers go out to his family and friends.

Heartbreaking images coming out of #Barcelona right now. We stand strong with our Spanish ally in the face of terror and steadfast in our commitment to defeating the enemies of democracy around the world.

This is a key moment for our nation. As I have said since Saturday, the violence and hate America saw from white supremacists and their affiliated groups has no place in this country.  I was disappointed and bothered by President Trump’s news conference and I sincerely hope that as the leader of our country he will unequivocally call these hate groups for what they are—evil.  It’s critical that all Americans, especially the President, stand against this type of hate and work toward preventing another tragedy like we saw in Charlottesville. Now more than ever, we need leaders who can work toward healing the wounds in our nation.

Did you know that Ambulatory Surgery Centers like Truvista Surgery Center in Troy save Medicare tens of millions of dollars every year? Great to sit down with Truvista's medical professionals to learn more about how we can ensure seniors have state-of-the-art healthcare options while protecting and strengthening Medicare.

The unparalleled work product of hardworking Michiganders is world-renowned. Another $2 million investment, right here, in Plymouth means Southeast Michigan will continue to lead the way in automotive innovation.

Drafting Table Brewing Company in Wixom is one of Michigan's newest 222 craft breweries. In fact, supporting a nearly $2 billion economy in Michigan alone, our state has the 6th highest number of craft breweries in the country. Grab a beer and support one of #MI11's newest small businesses.

In Afghanistan, our nation needs a defined and deliberate strategy. We need an all of the above approach that utilizes economic, diplomatic, and military force to defeat terrorism. I was encouraged to hear President Trump provide our brave servicemen and women with the flexibility they need to safely and effectively complete their mission and return home to their families as soon as possible and finally crack down on nations – like Pakistan – that harbor terrorists while pocketing U.S. foreign aid.  A calculated and measured strategy will help secure our national security and American citizens at home and abroad.
Please keep our neighbor U.S. Navy sailor Ken Smith and his family in your prayers.

The Blair Memorial Library has served the Clawson community since 1929, providing those of all ages with endless opportunities to explore, learn, and push the limits of their imagination. Great to be able to stop by to donate a variety of books from The Library of Congress to their already expansive collection.
My deepest sympathies go out to the family of Petty Officer Ken Smith and all those who had the privilege of knowing such a brave young man.

Devastating car accidents, critical and life-threatening situations - when every second counts air ambulances play a critical role in transporting patients and ensuring they receive the care they need as quickly as possible. I had the opportunity to ride along with Superior Air-Ground Ambulance Service out of Waterford to learn more about the important work they do and how we can ensure these medical professionals can continue to provide such a critical service to Southeast Michigan's communities.

On this day, our nation recognizes the amazing achievements of the generations of hard-working Americans who built this nation into the greatest country in the world. Wishing everyone in Southeast Michigan a happy Labor Day!

From autonomous vehicles to vehicle safety, it is always great to sit down with my colleague Rep. Debbie Dingell to discuss the future of the automotive industry. Today, we had a great discussion at Fiat Chrysler Automobiles with the Michiganders who continue to pave the way here, in the birthplace of our domestic auto industry, and around the world.

It was an honor to present military medals to Nina La Mara, the daughter of World War II veteran Gaspare La Marca (1912-1986) at a ceremony in Walled Lake.  Mr. La Marca was like so many of those we’ve come to know as our country’s Greatest Generation – he served his nation valiantly in WWII, worked as a manufacturer at Chrysler, and opened his own small businesses – living out the American dream he fought to defend. Raising his four children in Walled Lake, he went on to serve the community he loved so much as Mayor of Walled Lake. It was humbling to present his daughter with the 5 military medals he earned – a long overdue recognition of his service. While Mr. La Marca may no longer be with us, his love for his country and his community will be eternal.

Magna International is the largest automotive supplier in the U.S. employing over 2,600 workers in #MI11 alone. I had the opportunity to tour their Wixom facility, which specializes in powertrain systems, to learn how we can continue to encourage automotive suppliers to stay on this side of the border and hire more hardworking men and women, right here, in Southeast Michigan.

As the Great Lakes State, we are privileged to be surrounded by one of our world’s greatest natural wonders. Our lakes and everything they have to offer are a part of who we are as Michiganders. From boaters to anglers, it’s so important we protect our lakes and their habitats for generations to come. Great to stop by the Detroit Area Steelheaders Monthly Meeting to discuss their promotion of trout, salmon, and other fisheries throughout the Great Lakes Region.

Sara from Farmington is one of our community's most promising young leaders. Her outstanding service to our community and her initiative and drive to help those in need is inspiring. Her passion makes me so hopeful for the future of Southeast Michigan and it was an honor to present her with Congress' highest honor for our nation's youth  - the Congressional Award Gold Medal. She's more than earned it!

Today, I voted for legislation that adapts motor vehicle safety standards to advancing automotive technology and maximizes opportunities for research and development, creating more jobs and economic growth, right here, in Southeast Michigan.

5 of America's top 100 safest cities are, right here, in #MI11. Canton, Waterford, Novi, Rochester Hills, and West Bloomfield were ranked some of the safest communities in the entire country. It is so important to remember it is thanks to our local law enforcement officers who put their lives on the line every day, and they deserve nothing less than our full support.

There is no doubt the events of September 11th shook our nation to its core - a direct attack on the freedoms and liberties that make this country the greatest in the world. However, in the face of the worst of humanity we witnessed the best of it. The brave first responders who ran in when everyone ran out, the ordinary Americans who became extraordinary heroes - they represent the best of who we are. Let us never forget their heroism and courage and always pray for the families and loved ones they left behind.
LAST CALL: This Friday is the last day to submit your service academy application. If you or someone you know is interested in applying, please check out my website to learn more and apply.

When it comes to our country's homeland security, our local law enforcement agents are our first line of defense. I continued my efforts to support them in this critical mission by voting in favor of legislation that helps them continue to protect our neighborhoods, our state, and our entire nation.
I joined Morning Joe to talk about everything from Washington gridlock to DACA. Watch to get the latest on these developing issues.

All those involved in committing these horrendous crimes against innocent children, must be held accountable for their unconscionable actions. We must protect our girls, and my legislation tripling the federal penalty is critical to eradicating this barbaric practice from our communities. ➜ https://trott.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/trott-introduces-harsher-penalties-female-genital-mutilation

I have repeatedly called for the rejection of this weapons deal, and, finally, on the heels of the House passing my legislation to reject this sale, the Administration withdrew. This withdrawal points a finger in Erdogan’s chest and tells him a strategic location does not place Turkey above the law.
Calling all K-12 students: Have a great app idea? Don't miss the opportunity to enter it in this year's #MI11 Congressional App Challenge!
Hey Siri! How do kids sign up for this year's Congressional App Challenge? ➜ www.congressionalappchallenge.us
Michigan's pro-growth tax reform created more Michigan jobs and a growing economy. Our nation needs real tax reform, and the proof is in the #ComebackState.
That's why I'm working hard to TRIPLE the federal penalty for female genital mutilation and protect our girls from this barbaric practice. Learn more ➜ https://goo.gl/TiQJcp
Couldn't be happier to see my colleague Congressman Steve Scalise back at work in the People's House. #GeauxScalise

As we struggle to make sense of this inconceivable act of violence, my prayers are with the victims of this tragedy, their families, and the city of Las Vegas. The bravery exhibited by first responders and ordinary concertgoers is a reminder that even in our nation's darkest hours the fortitude of the American spirit will never fade.
Happy Manufacturing Day to the hardworking Michiganders who continue to innovate and pioneer the future of the  manufacturing industry.

Pacemakers and automated insulin pumps are just a few of the life-supporting medical devices so many Americans rely on each and every day. Connected to the internet, these devices are vulnerable to hacking and exploitation by cyber criminals. I introduced legislation that would take critical steps to ensuring the safety and security of these medical devices. ➜ https://goo.gl/1cX6KL
Did you know that Michigan has one of the highest student loan debt per capita ratios in the entire country at $5330 for every Michigander?

"Due to the secretive nature of this procedure, we are unlikely to ever know how many children..." -Asst. U.S. Attorney    We must protect our girls, which is why I introduced legislation to TRIPLE the federal penalty for committing this barbaric act ➜ https://goo.gl/TiQJcp

We must ensure Southeast Michigan small businesses have the resources they need to bolster their cybersecurity, combating 21st century threats and protecting both their business and their customers sensitive information.

Today, as we wish the U.S. Navy a happy 242nd birthday, let us remember the courage and bravery of all of our nation's sailors, especially Ken Smith of Novi who made the ultimate sacrifice in the line of duty earlier this year.

Dr. Chris Kirkpatrick was a psychologist at a VA medical center until he was fired for questioning the overmedication of the veterans being treated at his facility. Our veterans have earned the highest quality care. That's why I supported legislation to ensure whistleblowers like Dr. Kirkpatrick are not punished for protecting our nation's veterans.
From Staff: Happy Birthday Rep. Dave Trott!!

Detroit Catholic Central High School's robotics team went all the way to this year's world championships! I stopped by to congratulate the bright students behind the robot and check out their latest project.

500,000 girls in the United States have undergone or are at risk of female genital mutilation. This statistic hit home when 3 Livonia health care professionals were arrested for preforming this barbaric act. We must protect our girls, which is why I introduced legislation to TRIPLE the federal penalty.
Next time Livonia Resident Tom Camp drops by for a delivery, don't forget to congratulate him on 55 years of safe driving. He now holds the longest safe driving record in UPS history!

My legislation:  ✔ Provides greater clarity and access of information for consumers ✔ Helps provide more automotive loans for Michigan families  And it just passed the House Committee on Financial Services​ with bipartisan support.

Michigan is the #2 state for human trafficking, but our law enforcement officials are continuing to crackdown. I have and will continue to support legislation that gives them the resources they need to end this horrific illegal trade and protect our children.

As technology continues to be incorporated into the way our children learn and discover the world, the Novi Public Library is keeping up every step of the way. They're currently establishing a program by which they utilize their 3D printer to print prosthetic hands and arms free of charge for those in need. I stopped by to learn more about their great work.
There's only 2 weeks left to submit your app to this year's Congressional App Challenge. Learn more ➜ www.congressionalappchallenge.us/

3 doctors committed over 100 female genital mutilations out of their Livonia practice. These are professionals we trust with our children, and we must protect our girls by cracking down on this barbaric practice. That's why I'm working hard to TRIPLE the federal penalty for the perpetrators of this horrific crime.

Like so many of our nation's Vietnam veterans, 2nd Class Boatswain David Allen failed to receive the proper recognition when he returned home. While it's not in our power to rewrite history, we can ensure that each and every day going forward we offer our sincere thanks to all of our nation's veterans. 52 years after Mr. Allen began his service, I presented him with the 6 medals he rightfully earned, a small token of our nation's eternal gratitude.

It was great to stop by Farrand Elementary School in Plymouth to talk about the basics of our nation's government with some of our community's 3rd graders. So many thoughtful questions from our democracy's youngest participants makes me hopeful for the future of our great nation.

These unexplained, increasingly frequent railroad crossing blockages are obstructing emergency services, impeding Plymouth residents' mobility, and compromising driver safety. CSX must take substantive steps to resolve this serious situation, and I am holding them to it.

Pacemakers and automated insulin pumps are just two of the many internet-connected medical devices so many Americans rely on every day. Unfortunately, their internet connectivity also leaves them vulnerable to cyber hacking. I introduced legislation to protect the millions of Americans who rely on these life-sustaining devices ➜ https://goo.gl/fc2R6n

I demanded answers and a solution from CSX's CEO, and, in response, CSX has finally acknowledged the adverse impact their stalled trains are having on Plymouth residents. I'll be working hard to make sure they follow through on an effective solution.   From CSX: “CSX apologizes to the residents of Plymouth for the impacts caused by trains that have blocked crossings in the city. We understand the frustration of local residents and drivers, and we are taking this matter very seriously,."  “We are reviewing our options to reduce the impact of our operations, and CSX appreciates the community’s patience as we work through this issue and strive to be better neighbors to the residents of Plymouth.”

As many as 100 girls in Michigan became victims of female genital mutilation at the hands of 3 local health care professionals. SHARE if you agree with my legislation to TRIPLE the federal penalty for this horrific crime. Learn more ➜ http://www.freep.com/story/news/2017/06/07/female-genital-mutilation-doctors-michigan/378219001/

BIG NEWS: On Thursday, the House Judiciary Committee is taking action on my legislation to TRIPLE the federal penalty for female genital mutilation. We must protect our girls against this horrific crime. Learn more ➜ http://www.freep.com/story/news/2017/06/07/female-genital-mutilation-doctors-michigan/378219001/
Tonight, we stand shoulder to shoulder with our fellow Americans. The resolve of our great nation will not falter in the face of unconscionable evil.

In Michigan, Joan Larsen has earned a  reputation of independence and fairness. Well-qualified and well-respected, I have no doubt she will continue to make our state proud as she serves on the 6th Circuit U.S. Court of Appeals.
CSX assured us they would have the problem of trains blocking local railroad crossings for up to 9 hours solved by now. See something different? Let me know by commenting below.

Enbridge reportedly KNEW about damage to Line 5 for years, but remained silent as 23 million gallons of contaminants continued to be pumped through Line 5 every single day. Apologies won't cut it, Enbridge. That's why Rep. Debbie Dingell and I are pushing for legislation requiring a comprehensive study of the twin pipelines ➜ https://goo.gl/UjYkee

My legislation to TRIPLE the federal penalty for female genital mutilation continues to advance. I'm working hard to protect our girls and eradicate this barbaric practice from our community. In April, Michigan doctors - professionals we trust with our children - were arrested for committing as many as 100 female genital mutilations in Livonia. These doctors and all those responsible must be held accountable.

One of the most disturbing components of Obamacare is the Independent Payment Advisory Board, which would allow an un-elected, unaccountable board to hijack seniors' access to care. The board's ability to run rampant and unchecked is extremely troubling. That's why, I voted for bipartisan legislation that would repeal this board, preserving seniors access to health care and safeguarding their Medicare benefits.

Our troops have put their lives on the line to protect our nation, and it is our duty to ensure they have everything they need when returning to civilian life. That's why I voted to:   ✔ Support the care of wounded veterans ✔ Expand veterans' mental health services ✔ Streamline veterans' healthcare ✔ Promote the education and employment of our veterans
Happy birthday to the U.S. Marine Corps, and thank you to each and every marine over its 242 history who put their life on the line to protect our great nation.

For over two centuries, when our nation has been in need, our veterans have stepped forward to fight for the principles of freedom and liberty that make this country the greatest in the world. Today, we renew our committment to protecting and defending our veterans just as they protected and defended us.

Today, the House took the next step in reforming our antiquated tax code, delivering relief to those who need it most - hardworking families and job creators - by passing the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (H.R. 1). It is time for a simpler, fairer tax code that puts everyday Americans and their interests first.

It's a great day for Michigan as we celebrate Mahindra's facility expansion in Auburn Hills - the first new auto assembly plant in Southeast Michigan in more than 25 years! Mahindra's investment builds on our great State's rich automotive history and recognizes the critical role Michiganders have to play in revolutionizing the auto industry.

Wishing a very happy Thanksgiving to all in Southeast Michigan, as we gather together as friends and family to give thanks, reflect on the blessings of our country, the principles we share as Americans, and to watch the Lions beat the Vikings. Happy Thanksgiving!

ALERT: Tomorrow, the full U.S. House of Representatives will vote on my legislation to TRIPLE the federal penalty for female genital mutilation. We must protect our girls and make it clear that this practice will not be tolerated. Learn more → http://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/politics/2017/11/02/trott-bill-genital-multilation-congress/107267110/

BREAKING: Today, the U.S. House unanimously passed my legislation TRIPLING the federal penalty for female genital mutilation. This appalling and brutal practice has no place in Southeast Michigan, or the United States, and today we make it clear to Americans and the rest of the world that these heinous acts will not be tolerated.
76 years ago today, thousands of Americans lost their lives in the attack on Pearl Harbor. Today, we remember their heroism, bravery, and sacrifice that will never be forgotten. #PearlHarbor
Wishing a #HappyHanukkah to all celebrating in Michigan and across the United States.

BREAKING: Today, the House passed my commonsense, pro-consumer legislation modernizing the privacy notification process. This bill, known as the Privacy Notification Technical Clarification Act, will cut down on the high compliance costs companies are forced to pass along to consumers, while increasing consumer clarity and access to important privacy information.
On this day, December 15, 1791, the Bill of Rights was ratified. This action laid the foundation for our fundamental rights as Americans that we still hold dear and fight for today.
This week, Congress will consider the Tax Cuts & Jobs Act -  historic tax relief for everyday Americans for the first time in 31 years. Learn more → https://fairandsimple.gop

This overhaul of the complicated, burdensome tax code keeps more money in the pockets of hardworking Americans and supports our families by:  ✔ Significantly increasing the standard deduction - from $6,500 and $13,000 under current law to $12,000 and $24,000 for individuals and married couples, respectively  ✔ Expanding the Child Tax Credit from $1,000 to $2,000  ✔ Preserving the mortgage interest deduction, providing tax relief to current and aspiring homeowners  Learn more → https://fairandsimple.gop

Currently sitting at 35%, the highest in the industrialized world, the Tax Cuts & Jobs Act lowers the corporate tax rate to 21% and offers significant relief to Main Street job creators. This bill transforms the current tax climate to prevent American jobs, headquarters, and research from moving overseas.  Learn more → https://fairandsimple.gop

ONCE IN A GENERATION – Today, the House passed the final version of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, providing real tax relief for American families and businesses. It’s time to keep money in the pockets of hardworking Americans and Michigan families, and create more jobs, increase paychecks, and make the tax code simpler and fairer for all.
